lines.content: * Represents the Friday application that manages tasks for the user.
* Initializes the Friday application by loading tasks from the specified file.
* If the file cannot be loaded, initializes an empty TaskList and displays an error message.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are stored.
* Runs the Friday application, displaying the welcome message and reading commands from the user.
* The application continues to run until the user enters the "bye" command.
ui.showError("Please enter a valid date in the format yyyy-mm-dd.");
* The main method that starts the Friday application.
* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the specified task.
* @param task The task to be added to the task list.
* Adds the task to the task list, displays a message to the user, and saves the task list to file.
* @param tasks The task list to be modified by the command.
* @param ui The user interface to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The storage to save the task list to file.
* @throws FridayException If an error occurs during execution of the command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws FridayException {
throw new FridayException("Error saving tasks to file.");
* Represents a command that can be executed by the user.
* Executes the command with the specified task list, user interface, and storage.
* @param tasks The task list to be modified by the command.
* @param ui The user interface to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The storage to save the task list to file.
* @throws FridayException If an error occurs during execution of the command.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws FridayException;
* Indicates whether the command ends the scanner loop.
* @return false by default, indicating the scanner loop should continue.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified task index.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to be deleted from the task list.
* Deletes the task from the task list, displays a message to the user, and saves the task list to file.
* @param tasks The task list to be modified by the command.
* @param ui The user interface to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The storage to save the task list to file.
* @throws FridayException If an error occurs during execution of the command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws FridayException {
Task taskToDelete = tasks.getTask(taskIndex);  // Get the task to be deleted
tasks.removeTask(taskIndex);  // Remove the task from the list
ui.showTaskRemoved(taskToDelete, tasks.size());  // Show the user that the task was removed
storage.save(tasks.getTasks());  // Save the updated task list to the file
throw new FridayException("Error saving tasks to file.");
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* Displays a goodbye message to the user.
* @param tasks The task list that stores all tasks.
* @param ui The user interface to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The storage to save the task list to file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Indicates that the scanner loop should end.
* @return true, indicating the scanner loop should end.
* Represents a command to list all tasks.
* Displays all tasks in the task list.
* @param tasks The task list that stores all tasks.
* @param ui The user interface to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The storage to save the task list to file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to mark a task as completed.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified task index.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to be marked as completed.
* Marks the task as completed, displays a message to the user, and saves the task list to file.
* @param tasks The task list to be modified by the command.
* @param ui The user interface to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The storage to save the task list to file.
* @throws FridayException If an error occurs during execution of the command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws FridayException {
Task taskToMark = tasks.getTask(taskIndex);  // Get the task to be marked
tasks.markTask(taskIndex);  // Mark the task as completed
ui.showTaskMarked(taskToMark);  // Show the user that the task was marked
storage.save(tasks.getTasks());  // Save the updated task list to the file
throw new FridayException("Error saving tasks to file.");
* Represents a command to search for tasks on a specific date.
* Constructs a SearchCommand with the specified search date.
* @param searchDate The date to search for tasks on.
* Displays all tasks on the specified date.
* @param tasks The task list that stores all tasks.
* @param ui The user interface to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The storage to save the task list to file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to unmark a task as not completed.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the specified task index.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to be unmarked as not completed.
* Unmarks the task as not completed, displays a message to the user, and saves the task list to file.
* @param tasks The task list to be modified by the command.
* @param ui The user interface to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The storage to save the task list to file.
* @throws FridayException If an error occurs during execution of the command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws FridayException {
Task taskToUnmark = tasks.getTask(taskIndex);  // Get the task to be unmarked
tasks.unmarkTask(taskIndex);  // Unmark the task as not completed
ui.showTaskUnmarked(taskToUnmark);  // Show the user that the task was unmarked
storage.save(tasks.getTasks());  // Save the updated task list to the file
throw new FridayException("Error saving tasks to file.");
* Represents an exception that occurs in the Friday application.
* Represents an exception where the deadline argument is invalid.
super("The description of a deadline and date to be done by cannot be empty. " + "\n"
+ "     Please enter a valid deadline command: deadline <description> /by <date>.");
* Represents an exception where the delete argument is invalid.
super("Please key in a valid task number to be deleted." + "\n"
+ "     Please enter a valid delete command: delete <task number>" + "\n"
+ "     To view the list of tasks, type 'list'.");
* Represents an exception where the event argument is invalid.
super("The description of an event, the start date and the end date cannot be empty." + "\n"
+ "     Please enter a valid event command: event <description> /from <start date> /to <end date>.");
* Represents an exception where the command is invalid.
super("I'm sorry, but this command is invalid: " + command + "\n"
+ "     Please enter a valid command: list, todo, deadline, event, mark, unmark, delete, search, bye.");
* Represents an exception where the mark argument is invalid.
super("Please key in a valid task number to mark as done." + "\n"
+ "     Please enter a valid mark command: mark <task number>" + "\n"
+ "     To view the list of tasks, type 'list'.");
* Represents an exception where the search argument is invalid.
super("The search keyword cannot be empty." + "\n"
+ "     Please enter a valid search command: search <date>.");
* Represents an exception where the todo argument is invalid.
super("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* Represents an exception where the unmark argument is invalid.
super("Please key in a valid task number to unmark as done." + "\n"
+ "     Please enter a valid unmark command: unmark <task number>" + "\n"
+ "     To view the list of tasks, type 'list'.");
* Represents a parser that parses the user input.
* Parses the user input and returns the corresponding command.
* @throws FridayException If the user input is invalid.
public static Command parse(String userInput) throws FridayException {
* Represents the storage of tasks in a file.
* Constructs a Storage with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The file path of the file to store the tasks.
* Returns the file path of the storage.
* @return The file path of the storage.
* Handles the input string and returns the corresponding task.
* @param input The input string to be handled.
* @return The task corresponding to the input string.
* Loads the tasks from the file and returns the list of tasks.
* @return The list of tasks loaded from the file.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs during loading of the tasks.
System.out.println(" File not found. Creating new file...");
throw new IOException(" File is corrupted");
* Saves the list of tasks to the file.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be saved to the file.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs during saving of the tasks.
public void save(List<Task> tasks) throws IOException {
* Checks if the file is corrupted.
* @param file The file to be checked.
* @return True if the file is not corrupted, false otherwise.
* Constructs a deadline task with the specified task name that is not completed by default.
* The deadline of the task is parsed from the task name.
* Constructs a deadline task with the specified task name and completion status.
* Returns the string representation of the deadline task.
* @return The string representation of the deadline task.
* Returns the deadline of the deadline task.
* @return The deadline of the deadline task.
* Constructs an event task with the specified task name that is not completed by default.
* The start and end dates of the event are parsed from the task name.
* Constructs an event task with the specified task name and completion status.
* Returns the string representation of the event task.
* @return The string representation of the event task.
* Returns the start date of the event task.
* @return The start date of the event task.
* Returns the end date of the event task.
* @return The end date of the event task.
* Represents a task in the Friday application.
* Constructs a task with the specified task name that is not completed by default.
* Constructs a task with the specified task name and completion status.
* Returns true if the task is completed, false otherwise.
* @return True if the task is completed, false otherwise.
* Returns the string representation of the task to be written to the file.
* @return The string representation of the task to be written to the file.
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* @return The string representation of the task.
* Constructs a task list with an empty list of tasks.
* Constructs a task list with the specified list of tasks.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Removes a task from the task list.
* @param index The index of the task to be removed.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as completed.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as uncompleted.
* Returns the number of tasks in the task list.
* @return The number of tasks in the task list.
* Returns the task at the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Represents a to-do task in the Friday application.
* Constructs a to-do task with the specified task name that is not completed by default.
* Constructs a to-do task with the specified task name and completion status.
* Returns the string representation of the to-do task.
* @return The string representation of the to-do task.
* Represents the user interface of the application.
* Reads the command entered by the user.
* @return The command entered by the user.
System.out.println(" What can I do for you?");
System.out.println(" Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
System.out.println("     Here are the tasks in your list:");
* @param size The size of the task list.
public void showTaskAdded(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println("     Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("     Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* @param size The size of the task list.
public void showTaskRemoved(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println("     Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println("     Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("     Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("     OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
